poem:
### The Morning's Briefing

In this crossword of a world,  
where hawks circle over  
the crossword clues—  
"complete give-up" and "imminent,"  
I sip coffee, envision  
not a ceasefire,  
but a ceaseyear,  
where even the headlines are poets,  
pausing between words  
to watch the vowels of missiles fall silent.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The US president predicted Israel would not let up in its bombing campaign and suggested a decisive moment in that campaign was imminent, though he made clear he expected Israel to destroy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
